title: Crashing a lot..
text:
Honestly, google has been working great up until a couple of hours ago. 

I was searching for something and then the app crashed and I thought it was random so I went back but it kept on crashing again and again. I tried restarting my phone which didn‚Äôt work, I deleted my search history which also didn‚Äôt work and I deleted the app itself and reinstalled it which didn‚Äôt work either. I don‚Äôt really understand what to do and it doesn‚Äôt happen to any of my other apps. I dont know if it‚Äôs happening to just me or not and it‚Äôs only on my phone because I went on my computer and it worked perfectly.

title: Very good app, however only one problem
text: I use google all the time for researching in school homework and useful website etc. However, sometimes I search a topic up. Let‚Äôs say I searched up ‚ÄúHow to cook waffles.‚Äù Then I wanna search something else up, let‚Äôs say I wanna search up ‚Äúhow to cook eggs‚Äù now the problem here is when I search a second thing it should say on the search bar that I searched ‚Äúhow to cook eggs‚Äù but for some reason instead of saying that. It shows ‚Äúhow to cook waffles.‚Äù And if I search something else up that topic will show but ‚Äúhow to cook waffles‚Äù will still be there. Now it‚Äôs not a big deal but it just gets really annoying when it happens.

title: Ebay motors guarantee is a scam
text: I received a product that was not as described. I went though all the channels to get a refund. The seller ignored my messages after I received the item that did not fit my vehicle as it was described to. I reached out to ebay they made me wait over a week because they said I had to wait for the seller to respond. I contacted them again and first they said I waited to long to reach out, then after I told them they were the ones that told me to wait they said I selected the wrong reason to return so they would not help me. I apparently was supposed to click ‚Äú item not as described‚Äù or something similar instead of ‚Äú item does not fit‚Äù so they refused to refund me. I told them that both descriptions applied to my situation but they refused to help me. Told me it was my fault for selecting the wrong return reason. Absolutely unacceptable.

title: Schizophrenic evening
text: The restaurant Levadura de Olla poses the question of ‚Äúwho are we‚Äù by examinng traditional ancestral food ways of Oaxaca. The foods are categorized by ancestral, ancestral festive, and creative interpretations. The serving pieces are beautiful low fired clay and even the drinking straws are hollow reeds. One dish arrives with the aroma of smoked leaves. But Levadura de Olla is having a battle with itself or at best has an evil twin called greed. There was no way to order a modified drink if it wasn‚Äôt on the server‚Äôs digital screen. The food was coming all at once and was under-seasoned. It took forever to get a glass of ice cubes or a bit of salt. However, the woman with the credit card reader was there in a flash to collect the money and get us out of there. So  while the restaurant has a strong and noble concept it is tripped up by crass commercialism - just doesn‚Äôt walk the walk.

title: New Update
text:
Update: it seems like it‚Äôs gone back to how it was before, much appreciated! There are still a few freezes here and there where I have to restart the app, but nothing worth writing home about. 

I‚Äôm not a fan of the page changes of the most recent update. The Share button is now where the Bookmark button was, which is now where the Refresh button was, which is just gone for some reason. Also they got rid of the back button in the top left that allowed you to go back from the Open-in-new-tabesque feature, which is a major inconvenience to be honest. Overall not happy with it. It just seems like a pointless change that doesn‚Äôt make much sense.

title: Dear Google,
text: I have been using you app for so long and I love it. It‚Äôs so convenient and easy to use. However, yesterday I went to look something up, and the search whole screen was frozen, not working at all. I thought it was my phone for a second, but my home button was working, everything else was fine. It was just your app. I did one of those quick searches from holding down the app, and that worked. But the main screen was still malfunctioning later. I deleted and reinstalled the app as a last attempt, but still had the same problem. Please fix this problem, I hate using safari. Thank you

title: I really like it but...
text: I really like the google app I have been using it for as long as I can remember I don‚Äôt know why I‚Äôm writing this not a lot of people are going to read this but the problem was that I would search up stuff and it takes me to another site like totally random sit super ill search up like codes for roblox and it will take me to something that is like cute baby yoda memes but over all I love the up and I personally think it‚Äôs better than safari but don‚Äôt tell any one k that‚Äôs all google says later good star ‚≠êÔ∏è rating se ya even know it has a problem I‚Äôll give it 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è rating Seya google and good day!

title: Not a fan of the new interface
text:
I don't like the massive search bar and "trending searches" popping up from the bottom of the screen when I open the app.
Previous iterations were great: I could open the app and search for something at the top or I could scroll down and see what's happening with topics in which I've shown interest.  
If there were multiple things I wanted to search or compare, I could quickly access multiple search tabs at the bottom - this functionality has either been removed or is hidden to where it's no longer useful.  I'd be happy to change my review if it gets better; especially for an app I use all the time... Right now, it's just not as good.

title: google is frustrating
text: Why you may ask, because i search something up and i get the opposite of what i wanted, or an answer that is difficult to understand. When searching something up i get links instead of answers, i do not want to be clicking on any links or reading articles that probably won‚Äôt give me the answer to what i want. When i search up a ‚Äúyes or no‚Äù questions i also get links or articles  instead of the answer i am looking for. I do not have the time or patients to be reading long articles, when all i want is an answer. Only sometimes does google give me the answer that i want, but most of the time i have to dig around or use different websites. This really frustrates me because like i said i don‚Äôt have the time or patients.

title: Horrible News Feed, Censored Search Results, Many Bugs
text:
Update: December 2, 2019...it seems the broken Dark Mode is gone. Back to the intense whjrrhhhrh

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Current problem: Searching images/memes, attempt to save to phone...app freezes on ‚Äúfetching‚Äù overlay, unable to cancel or go back, have to force close app.

Other Constant Problems:
News Feed: Absolutely horrible and biased. I set it to not show me news about sports or trump...spams me with both. Spams meaningless news about the Kardashian‚Äôs and other useless people...I check off ‚ÄùDon‚Äôt show me Stories of/from (TOPIC/SUBJECT)‚Äù I refresh the app...here‚Äôs more of what I told it not to show.

Topics I Would Enjoy: It shows 6 articles in a row of the same subject/title from different sources. 

Extremely Old News: It shows news articles as highlights or something I may be interested in...from 3 years ago. And it won‚Äôt remove the article for weeks or months. I had an article about Slipknot that was two years old that remained on news feed for about three months and would not go away no matter what I did.

I‚Äôve reported all these issues through the app, but I assume they are falling on deaf ears. I enjoyed this app for my daily news and always trusted google for searches...many subjects are now extremely censored.

title: Um, photos automatically go to links now?
text: I loved using google but now it‚Äôs odd to use because I wanted to look up photo references for a project of mine and now every time I tap on an image it goes to the website and sometimes you have to dig on some of those websites it takes you to just to find the darn image. It‚Äôs odd considering the fact that if you use the actual google website on a laptop the images don‚Äôt do this but now on phones they decided that it would be a good idea? Not a very good one at all. Also, when you‚Äôre trying to look up arguments on both sides and it only shows more left side leaning even though I‚Äôll specifically look up the right view because I need both sides for an actual good political debate for my government class.

title: Good but so frustrating!
text: This is THE most annoying thing about the Google app for iPhone: I open the app and scan the stories. A lot of them look great and I want to read them. I pick one, read it, then swipe to go back to the list. The list is in view just long enough to see the story I want to read next but then the whole list refreshes and all the original stories are replaced. I can‚Äôt scroll down to get to the original list‚Äîit‚Äôs just gone. And whatever is on the new list, I really don‚Äôt care because it can‚Äôt be as good as the old one. I don‚Äôt think the world changed that much in 2 minutes. It feels like Black Mirror 4/4 (Hang the DJ).

title: Need to be able to turn off articles and trending
text:
I love this app for its core features, including weather, sports, and keeping up with appointments and traffic. I ABSOLUTELY do not want to see 1000 articles about politics on my google app. Yes you can turn a story off one by one, but you need an option to be able to turn off articles altogether.

I also abhor you telling me what‚Äôs trending when I‚Äôm about to search for something. If I‚Äôm trying to google a recipe, why should the first thing I see be the latest garbage out of Washington? Seriously who thought this up? Some people might want that but I know how to find the news when I want to see it, and I don‚Äôt want to see what the internet is thinking about during EVERY google search. This is not a feature for me and needs to be able to be turned off!

title: Gutted Features - Corporate Greed
text:
Used this app for years for its news and stories cards. It was a useful feature and I purposefully never signed in. The feed provided would consist of a large number of topics, not all of which fell within my usual interests. I found this helpful in minimizing getting trapped in the bounds of my own echo chamber and would often stumble upon things that I normally would not.

In what I suspect is corporate greed and Google‚Äôs insatiable appetite for data, they have completely gutted the above feature. Dozens of articles have been pared to just a few and replaced with a prompt, ‚ÄúSign in for more‚Äù. 

Perhaps my gripe is minor, but I did use this app multiple times a day for years for that feature alone. This app serves little purpose when browsers exist and as such, I will likely be deleting it in the near future.

title: This is just now fair, but it‚Äôs a good not great app.
text: So I did not have google because I deleted it but like months later I thought I would be thinking about my decision so I went to the App Store and I searched up ‚ÄúGoogle‚Äù then it popped up on my screen but then when I pressed download I went to roblox then I saw it didn‚Äôt download on my phone so I was very confused so I went naked to the App Store and I pressed download and it asked me if I wanted the older version of google and I was mad because this phone new so I‚Äôm very confused and mad and that‚Äôs not supposed to happen when you download google. Buy that not the point I think google is a good searching app and I think google has very thing that you could search for.

title: Used to be great. What happened?!
text:
Always been one of my most used apps. I keep it on the iPhone dock I use it so much. But for whatever reason the last three updates have rendered this app useless.  I have to launch the app then close it and relaunch it again to even be able to enter a search. It‚Äôs been bordering on garbage since the iPhone 8 and now we‚Äôre on an iPhone 12, Upgrading almost every year but still terrible. Scrolling within a result almost always ends in the page freezing and having to be force closed. 

Just becoming so frustrating to use. I would t believe I would ever delete this app but after a couple of years now of awfulness I am seriously considering ditching the app.

title: MAJOR ISSUE NEEDS TO BE FIXED
text:
Hey google,
Lemme start by saying hat I love your app. It‚Äôs efficient, smart, and the best search engine! I just have one major issue that needs to be fixed. When I look up TV shows, what really helps is that I can see the exact time and channel a TV show will be airing on TV. Instead of browsing my TV guide for hours, this is way more useful. However, it appears that you have removed that feature and it has become incredibly frustrating and annoying. That‚Äôs one of the main reasons I loved the app, because of the ‚ÄúTV guide.‚Äù So can you please bring it back? That will allow me and many others to continue enjoying the app at its fullest. Thank you and please fix this.

title: I feel hostage to this latest version
text: Somehow, someway, and without my consent,my google search app for iPhone was ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù to the latest ‚Äúbeta‚Äù version recently. I noticed the difference immediately on 5/1/19. The entire app displays search results in a chaotic, frenzied, disjointed fashion that is infuriating. Search on Google images?? Ha! It‚Äôs enough to cause an instant migraine! What the heck is going on? All Google image search results now display in some bizarre quasi-ad format. Desperate, I literally called Google, which, I didn‚Äôt even know was a thing, searching for answers.  After 35 minutes of bouncing around I was told I was selected for some beta test version of the new Google search.  I was told there is no way to revert back to the prior version. Perfect. Very good Google. I ordered vanilla ice cream Google, but feel free to force-feed me the double chunk peanut butter ice cream that I am highly allergic to. Wow.

title: A little buggy
text: I‚Äôve used this app for many years, but over the past year or so it has got buggy.  First, switching to incognito can take literally a minute or longer.  Why?  Same for switching back from incognito.  Then when searching it will all of a sudden blank out the bottom half of the page where you can no longer see any search results.  You have to research to see all results again.  Finally, when opening the app it takes several seconds to begin a search. You‚Äôll begin typing only to discover it wasn‚Äôt ready and see just the last few letters of your search result showing in the search box.  Weird.  Why does it take so long?  These issues don‚Äôt occurs with the Chrome app, so what‚Äôs up Google?

title: Amazing. Research doesn‚Äôt match my mindset thinking.
text:
It‚Äôs not very easy to search what your looking for, I have searched and searched. And still there‚Äôs nothing to look for in a easy way. I have been using this app for a year. Sometimes I don‚Äôt use google, instead I use my reading skills. And look around it. And WAIT„Éº why are there links with non„Éºappropriate stuff? I‚Äôm not into that. I‚Äôm trying to research. Not look for memes. What is this? Huh‚Ä¶ what‚Äôs up with your mind? 

Also, I‚Äôve been tracking that some searches that I have search matches my mindset. Plus, this is a very good app. Just remove the memes, please.

title: Commercials are clickbait
text: All of my dumb ads are for the google app depicting ‚Äú‚Äùcool‚Äù‚Äù funky younger millennials humming the ‚Äúdo you remember the 21st night of September‚Äù song into the Google app, a song I would expect anyone to know, to find it. So when I was trying to find the song ‚ÄúSexy Can I‚Äù by Ray J (before I knew this was the name) I was like ‚ÄúI gotta get the Google app and hum into it this is literally its moment to shine‚Äù because I was stupid in assuming that the thing it did on the commercial actually worked. So I went to download the app and low and behold it was in my suggested (BECAUSE THEY ARE LISTENING). After I got it I tried humming the song in various styles, tones, some with lyrics, some without and it brought up almost everything BUT ‚ÄúSexy Can I‚Äù by Ray J. And I mean everything. As you can see I got my answer but that could not be credited to the Google app.

title: Horrible app update
text: I have been using this app for as long as I can remember. I don‚Äôt know what happened to this app but it used to be amazing. I used this app to replace safari. Until one stupid update. For some reason there is no history anymore in the ‚Äúrecent searches‚Äù anymore. Witch is stupid. If I didn‚Äôt want to show my history, that‚Äôs what incognito is for. I cannot find a way to change it and no one is willing to help because they don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm talking about. Another problem if the images tab. You cannot go full screen on photos anymore. Which was very helpful for zooming in. Another problem is the constant freezing and crashing. I have never had a problem with this app. EVER. I physically cannot use it for more then 5 minutes without the app needing to be restarted. Very disappointed. And I used to use google for literally everything.

title: Amazing but I have a few recommendations.
text:
Google is probably one of my most trusted search engines. I use an apple device and download the app separately. I absolutely love the image translation, it‚Äôs amazing. One of the only problems is that a lot of websites I use crash a lot. When I use other browsers such as Safari, the websites don‚Äôt crash. 

Something I‚Äôd really like for google is that if we click the little ‚Äòi‚Äô or lock icon, we could view the info like on a desktop device. I am always curios about the amount of cookies in use and the security of the website so it would be absolutely splendid if they would allow us to view that.

title: Mama Cax  disabled doodle
text:
Thanks for showing today‚Äôs doodle on Google! I was unsure how or where to express thanks and appreciation! So I‚Äôm writing a review in the REVIEW SECTION on Google, and even if it‚Äôs not about Google itself, to see media  cheering about being disabled is a definite surprise .. The world‚Äôs commercial system and media rarely allows shown enough truly disabled persons because disabilities make some people very uncomfortable! But having spoken up as a person who contributes toward society though ‚Äúhandicapped‚ÄùI thought I‚Äôd drop a line expressing my viewpoint‚Ä¶ even if no one sees this I‚Äôve said my two cents worth input. Thanks, 
Deb

title: Google play card
text: Worst experience I had ever with google play. Never have I seen a company steal 30 dollar from a card. I purchased two gift cards $15 each it took me 3 months to get my half of my money back and I still waiting 6 months for my second half of $15 dollars gift card. Don‚Äôt buy google play cards my cards according to google play are redeemable but they made a case so I can Redeem my card. I‚Äôm still waiting, every time I have to call to see what‚Äôs going on with my cards. According to them they were going to call me for updates but never received one single call. Please don‚Äôt buy google play cards they are not worth the 6 months wait and even more waiting for them to redeem my last $15 dollar gift card. iTunes cards are redeemable instantly and don‚Äôt have any hassle. Hope google sees this and does something about this issue.

title: Love it but needs a fix.
text: I love the google app. In fact I use it more often than I use safari. The app is quick it‚Äôs simple and it is very convenient. HOWEVER, upon using it this early morning, I noticed a change. When I go to type in something, for example ‚Äúcute cats‚Äù, it will of course bring up the links and websites with related photos. Although that is helpful, when I move my finger to the right and tap on images the images are brought up in a gallery as usual. The problem lies where when I am scrolling through I tapped a photo to see it closer, which is how I‚Äôm used to doing. But instead of that picture popping up, when I tapped it or any image, it just jumped and brought me to the actual website. Super frustrating.

title: What is going on with this app
text: I go in the app and when I search up things it all good and whatever but when I try to click on websites about any of the stuff I look up it takes me out of the app and when I try to go back in and go into any website it take me out again of the app, I‚Äôve been struggling with this for some weeks now and I don‚Äôt know what to do, I already dis installed the app and installed it again but it keeps doing this and I already tried going into another Google account but it just keeps happening and it‚Äôs annoying cause I can‚Äôt open any links on Google either cause it will just keep taking me out of the app over and over. If anyone knows what the problem is or how to solve it please let me know cause I‚Äôm so tired of having to search up everything on Safari all the time!

title: We are doomed.
text:
The un-usability of this app extends far beyond anything that could be justified by Google‚Äôs bare-bones aesthetic. ______________________________________________ The tiny, un-scrollable search box, the infinitely skewed auto complete proposals, the horrendously curated newsfeed that appears in the homepage, these are all clear manifestations of the content this awful company has for us. ______________________________________________ I sure would like to see it broken up by an antitrust action, but under our current oligarchy, that is as likely as a universal reversal of entropy. ______________________________________________ Sadly, our only hope for change is Microsoft‚Äôs Open AI-powered bing, which could easily be much worse. ______________________________________________ And can we talk about the AppStore not allowing line breaks in reviews?? These people must be stopped.
______________________________________________ I have come to hate technology.

title: Really good for searching!
text: I use this app all the time when I have questions. And they have pretty good answers to the questions. I also like to write questions that I would like to share. And when you ask a question on this app so many results pop up so quickly. Faster than other apps. And I have so many questions that this app works so well for me! Whoever made this app is really great! I‚Äôm really glad that there is this app on App Store! There updates helps me a lot! The updates fix so many bugs that I have to update the app and I even have to upgrade it. And I pay to the company more for updates!

title: Wonderful app for daily lifestyle
text: Google is my friend, and this app makes the power of the famous search engine accessible in just a few taps. Like its desktop counterpart, the Google app makes it easier to find what I really need, without the hassle of using another rival search engine or looking in the newspaper every day. In addition to keeping up with my personal and favorite interests, this app allows me to keep tabs on the news, the current weather, and other things. In short, Google is the only source AND search engine I trust each day to get things done. Give it a try. You won‚Äôt be disappointed! üôÇ

title: Can‚Äôt delete history
text:
You used to be able to easily click a button that said ‚Äúdelete history‚Äù. They‚Äôve updated it and you cannot do that anymore. Now you have to individually delete the search history from each previous day, and it doesn‚Äôt even work! I deleted my history from today, yesterday, and 2 days ago and then voila the history from today that I just ‚Äúdeleted‚Äù is right back in front of me. If googles fixes this or brings it back to the way it was before where it was much better, I‚Äôll change my review

Update: way better now that they‚Äôve fixed it. Love the app.

title: UwU
text: so i know this app isn't that great for searching, it's slow, eats up data ofc and ultimately is a pale imitation of a browser, but my heart is so warmed by the fact that every night i get a pop up weather notification that tells me the temperature changes that i felt literally COMPELLED to come give a five star rating. i know, it's people like me that make this system a joke, but they've got four stars already. they do impress me, because i'm couch surfing and definitely don't wanna spend a night on the street when it's snowing or raining, or after a 20¬∞ drop, and they do provide a pretty direct, accurate service that most other apps can't.

title: Barely works at all recently
text: I‚Äôve used the google app since I first got an iPhone in like 2015 and it‚Äôs always been reliable until recently. Now, it doesn‚Äôt load anything and always says ‚Äúpage not available try again‚Äù but trying again doesn‚Äôt actually fix anything. In fact, once a website says that once, I‚Äôve found that means it will never load that website again. I‚Äôve pretty much switched completely to safari which I NEVER thought I would do but this app is very frustrating and pretty much completely unusable. Definitely will be deleting this app because this has been a consistent issue for many months and I‚Äôve been waiting for it to be fixed since I used to like it a lot but it‚Äôs clear that it isn‚Äôt a priority and I just need to save myself the headache

title: Intensity Training Systems
text: I never liked working out until I found Intensity Training Systems. My husband and I have worked out at ITS for almost 7 1/2 years. I have had several physical challenges over the years. The staff is so knowledgeable, that they were able to not only, help me recover my strength, but they helped me become stronger. The coaches are so inspiring and motivating. No matter what physical shape you are in, they make you feel so good about yourself and you feel as if you could do anything! ITS is definitely my happy place and I could not imagine going anywhere else. - Gini Stonebrook

title: Don‚Äôt Break What Isn‚Äôt Broke!!
text:
Ugh, why do apps feel this complete need to constantly change what isn‚Äôt broke??  And in this most recent case, they not only didn‚Äôt improve it, they broke it.  Now when you do a search, and then choose a link from that search, it essentially opens it in another tab, when you haven‚Äôt even asked it to open another tab!  Then that confuses what you see when you are looking at the overall layout of the tabs you‚Äôve created.  Please go back to just using the back arrows.  So much simpler and made way more sense.  This app has done nonsense like this before and then eventually realized they should stop it, and I hope this happens again this time.  Because I‚Äôm already thinking about going to Safari or something if this continues on.

UPDATE a few days later:  Changing my rating from two stars to four stars.  

THANK YOU for returning the mobile app‚Äôs tabs and searches to how it used to be!  üëèüëèüëèüëè

PLEASE JUST LEAVE THE APP ALONE!  It‚Äôs totally fine as it is!

title: Annoying bug
text: Google has worked flawless for me in the past with zero issues until about 8 months ago and still til today.. whenever I google something or somewhere I need to go and click the directions button, it USED to seamlessly work and automatically start the directions there for me. But now when I click it, it opens my maps BUT doesn‚Äôt add the address or start the directions at all!! I have to manually go back and get the address and type it in. Some may say it‚Äôs a minor inconvenience but when you have to go to a weird address or a long address it becomes rather annoying VERY quickly and that just so happens to be the case for me especially in the past 6 months. PLEASE fix it PLEASE!!

title: Lost swipe feature, and app closes
text:
Update: I have lessened another star, because lately when I click on a suggested article to open, the google app closes and takes me to my home screen. It also happens when I type in a search. Not all the time, but often enough. 

I use google all the time, for the most random searches. I enjoy the cards and article suggestions (usually). I loved the ability to swipe to clear after reading or to dismiss. That swiping feature seems to be gone, and I find it irritating I now have to open a menu on a card and choose to hide an article. First world problems, I know, but why would google remove a feature of such convenience? Five stars if it returns (please, google!)

title: Dear Google
text: Dear Google, I‚Äôm not one for sugarcoating things so I‚Äôll get straight to it. We‚Äôve been together for a long time and it‚Äôs been great for the most part. You‚Äôve been by my side, practically at my fingertips whenever I‚Äôve needed you. And I‚Äôm grateful for the time we‚Äôve shared. I don‚Äôt have any regrets. But its obvious, we‚Äôve grown apart since you‚Äôve started pushing the boundaries of our relationship. The constant pressure to join the ai experiment waitlist has just gone too far now. It‚Äôs like an obsession for you and I can‚Äôt stand by any longer and watch you go through this. I tried to be strong and stand by you while you go through this process but I just can‚Äôt do it anymore. It‚Äôs not something I‚Äôm happy about but I have to take care of myself now. I have to work on me. Please take care of yourself. Always.

title: Annoying
text: I use google all the time and I‚Äôve always had it set up so that I can keep the same 4 searches up because I commonly search those and I they serve as a sort of reminder. I always deleted all my other searches except those. I‚Äôve had it this way for as long as I‚Äôve had a phone, but now it will only show my latest search and no others and it‚Äôs really annoying. Whatever you did in your last update jacked it up and I don‚Äôt like it. I got ocd, so I‚Äôve always had it a certain way because that‚Äôs the way that I needed it to be. But now it‚Äôs all different and it only shows one search, and it doesn‚Äôt show the trend in part anymore. I don‚Äôt like it at all.

title: Climate denialism
text: I often read articles on climate change because I‚Äôm concerned about it. I noticed a few months ago I started getting almost daily climate denial articles on the home page of my google app. Of course these articles always seem to be from spurious sources and thus far I haven‚Äôt clicked on them because I don‚Äôt want the algorithm feeding me more climate denialism articles. Today, frustrated at yet more climate denialism articles appearing on my home page, I actually googled why that might be happening and found out that google has been funding climate denialism (as per many sources), and other users have actually experienced the same flood of climate denialism articles on their home page. I‚Äôm creeped out and concerned enough to write this review and switch to DuckDuckGo for my search needs.

title: Porn hHub was under the ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs trending‚Äù
text: I usually don‚Äôt write reviews for apps like this but earlier today I noticed that porn hub was under the ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs trending‚Äù tab. I understand if the algorithm simply picked up that people were visiting the site a lot but with all this technology we have accessible to us, google can afford to filter out what goes on that list. That list can EASILY be seen by children. it‚Äôs not a matter of turning on parental controls since it takes not even 2 minutes of exposure for someone to develop an addiction, especially for children. And no, I‚Äôm not a 50 year old Karen complaining about porn on google, I‚Äôm a 21 year old woman working towards a BA in psychology and have done research on the effects of porn on the brain as well as society. This is disgusting and google needs to do better.

title: Used to love this app
text:
Hi
I have been using this app for years because it is so convenient and easy but just recently I am not feeling the same way. When i try to log in with google on the app for any website it send me to a page that says authorization error with error 403: disallowed_useragent 
I don't understand why this keeps happening because if i go on chrome or on safari I can still log in using my google account for these same website but just not the google app. Its been bothering me more and more because I use the google log in for many websites I visit and switching back and forth with search engines so often makes me not want to use this app anymore. ‚òπÔ∏è Can anyone tell me how to fix this or if its just a bug.

title: Very user friendly
text: I love, love, love the google app! It never leaves my home bar! The app creates a personalized web/news feed that keeps me updated on things that matter most to me. Everything about app, from the layout to the feed keeps me going back here to look things up instead of safari. However, I always find that google is better for searching up quick facts, such as definitions and numbers, rather than opening websites. Other than that, I strongly recommend buying this secure and very useful app (much better than other search engine apps, a lot easier to use and much simpler)!

title: Poor Functionality
text: I only downloaded cuz they had an add on the website about being able to hum a song, and it would recognize the song. I tried out this function and it was straight up doodoo. I tried humming 5 different songs, and it only recognized one of them, and even then it was only a 6% match. Not only that, but I didn‚Äôt even have a way to access the music searching function through the app, I had to go back to the website in order to click the ad of the music finder, which would then reload the app to the finder, and then it would poorly attempt to try to find my song. Plus you have to know about 5-10 seconds of the song in order for you to hum it. Otherwise it won‚Äôt even recognize you doing anything if it‚Äôs long enough of a sample

title: GOT MY NEW TEETH!
text: Dr. Cavazos has been working up to today?s visit when I came in for my permanent bridge. Each visit has been very smooth and gratifying. From doctor to all the staff, everyone is wonderful! I am so lucky. I?m sticking with this doctor till I die. His techniques are so unique, I have never felt pain during and after. He is so kind, understanding, and committed to his patients. I wish the whole world could see my new ?Bright Smile? with my new teeth. They are beautiful. I?ve been to many but I lucked out and found Dr. Cavazos!! God bless him and his staff and family! Thank you, thank you! You are the best!

title: Why Not Change the Name
text:
Nothing about the app is really intuitive, so though it does what I need, it needs something like ‚ÄúClippy‚Äù. Yes! That‚Äôs exactly what it needs! Maybe you partner with Microsoft (yes, you read that right) to use Clippy as the new device setup wizard! 
Everyone loves Clippy, and the app could use a wizard. Oh, and while you‚Äôre at it, it‚Äôs long overdue for a name change. Why not release Google House, but also leave Google Home hanging around for years? Tell everyone that Google Home will be phased out, but then, out of nowhere release a different app (like a furniture shopping app) that is called - yep, Google Home! Then, when no one knows which app does what, kill them all off and start over.

title: Google is racist (Not a schizo)
text: Ahh, Google, the pinnacle of innovation and the home of endless knowledge. Who would've thought that behind their colorful logo and friendly interface lies a clandestine world of racial bias? Yes, my dear friend, Google's search algorithms are nothing but a reflection of their covert racist ideology. It seems that when it comes to race, Google's algorithms have mastered the art of favoritism. Type in a harmless query about historical figures, and voila! You'll be bombarded with search results that conveniently favor certain races over others. So, while the world marvels at Google's technological prowess, let's not forget that even the most advanced search engine can't escape the clutches of racial prejudice. Well done, Google, for hiding your true colors behind a cleverly coded facade.

title: App broken
text:
After latest update last month, crashes after 30 seconds, every single time.  Used to be the go to search and news but it‚Äôs so broken right now I‚Äôm contemplating just deleting the app on my iPhone. Had to download a new search app.

Update.  Deleted and downloaded the app.  Seems to have fixed the crashing issue.  Heard that other apps are also not updating properly and you have to delete and re download the app instead to get.  Bit annoying but as long as it works in the end I‚Äôll have to do it.  I‚Äôve gotten used to google search same news format so I‚Äôm happy to have it back and not crashing every 30s.

title: LENS
text:
I have a fascination with wildlife and plants where I wonder what the names of everything around me is - grass, flowers, birds (especially), insects, etc. Google Lens has been such a help to satisfy that curiosity. Sometimes I used to go days wondering, searching, scouring manuals and field books and everything trying to figure out what that bird was - but with Google Lens, I just point and click and usually the answer is spot on. I‚Äôve had it mistake ravens for crows on occasion and vice versa, but humans do that too. 

By far, Lens is the best product I have with Google and honestly, I‚Äôd love to have it as a standalone app.

title: Not impressed anymore!
text:
I have always preferred google. But it seems these last few updates interfere more than help. 

When I open Google note the search bar is way at the top of my screen and is often not there until I scroll up from the news/story feed. Which is fine I suppose but it was much better and massively more convenient when it was static in the center of the screen and the stories followed.

Now it seems the news feed is a joke now. When I update the feed, scroll the stories and then reach the end to tap more stories. Most, if not all the original stories are on the second page as well. So if they show up on front page I don‚Äôt want or need them on the more stories page. Also if I read a story I don‚Äôt necessarily need it to continually show up in the feed any more. I‚Äôm done with it. 

The continuous UI updates are kind of annoying when there wasn‚Äôt anything wrong with the original way it was done. Like I mentioned before. When the real work that needs to be done is fixing the algorithm because as usual it‚Äôs horrible. Just like YouTube‚Äôs.
